definition: reluctant to leave/to hate to have to go/to recall fondly
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
to feel attached to/to long for/to love

sentences.english: Although I like the seeds of spring, lingering summer lotus.
sentences.chinese: 雖然，我喜歡春日的萌芽，留戀夏日的荷花。

sentences.chinese: 單純的莪，總是爲罘值得留戀的愛情而哭泣。

sentences.english: The eagerly await its arrival and always ask when she and her dog will be back.
sentences.chinese: 這些老人們盼着狗狗地到來，並當她帶起狗時很留戀。

sentences.english: So "Moonshadow Japanese Restaunrant" will be the best place of enjoy youself.
sentences.chinese: “月影日本料理”將是您留戀忘返的最佳去處。

sentences.english: I no longer feel devoted to this place.
sentences.chinese: 我不再會留戀這個地方了。

sentences.english: Look again at the favorite in my wandering among the gloomy serious away.

sentences.english: The Blossoming of love in life, but also recall with nostalgia the network of song and laughter.
sentences.chinese: 喜歡生活中的奼紫嫣紅，也留戀網絡裏的歡歌笑語。

sentences.english: May be locked lonely heart of the spring, or is nostalgia.
sentences.chinese: 或許是寂寞鎖住了春心，又或者是留戀。

sentences.english: I have this lake in the shadow of the bridge stay, and this is quite nostalgia.
sentences.chinese: 我曾在此湖的橋上留過影，對此地還是挺留戀。

sentences.english: The French have already looked beyond him, but he is unready to say adieu.
sentences.chinese: 法國人已不留戀他，但也不準備說再見。

sentences.english: Lila Culpepper: There's too much beauty to quit.
sentences.chinese: 有太多美好的東西值得留戀。

sentences.english: In the dark blue sky you keep, And often through my curtains peep.
sentences.chinese: 你留戀這漆黑的天空，時常透過我的窗簾窺看。

sentences.english: One suggestive finding is that when unemployment insurance becomes more generous, not everybody lingers on benefits.
sentences.chinese: 當失業救濟金時，並非所有人都對此留戀不捨。

sentences.english: We linger in the lowlands because we are afraid to climb the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 我們留戀在地上，因爲我們怕攀山越嶺。

definition: to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to be in a tangle/to nag
to worry about/to be concerned about
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
